title: Update dependency fast-glob to v3.1.1
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [fast-glob](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob) | dependencies | minor | [`3.0.4` -> `3.1.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/fast-glob/3.0.4/3.1.1) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>mrmlnc/fast-glob</summary>

### [`v3.1.1`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/releases/3.1.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/v3.1.0...3.1.1)

#### 🐛 Bug fixes

##### Stream is not closed when the receiver is closed ([#​239](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/239))

Previously, we read directories in the stream, even after the receiver is closed. Now we stop reading after closing the receiver by `.emit('end')`, `.destroy()` or `for await...of`.

```js
const fg = require('fast-glob');

(async () => {
    const stream = fg.stream('**');

    for await (const entry of stream) {
        console.log(entry);

        return;
    }
})();
```

Most likely, in future releases, we will improve integration with streams ([#​243](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/243)).

### [`v3.1.0`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/releases/v3.1.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/3.0.4...v3.1.0)

#### 💬 Common

-   New method [`isDynamicPattern`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob#isdynamicpatternpattern-options) as an alternative to [`glob.hasMagic`](https://togithub.com/isaacs/node-glob#globhasmagicpattern-options) ([#​105](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/105))
-   New method [`escapePath`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob#escapepathpattern) for escaping parts of the paths of the pattern ([#​158](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/158))

#### 📖 Documentation

-   Add documentation for [`generateTasks`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob#generatetaskspatterns-options) helper.
-   Fix examples for the [`dot`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob#dot) option. 

#### 🐛 Bug Fixes

-   Matching specific file is not found when pattern contains parentheses ([#​223](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/223))
    -   ⚠️ Now we route patterns with escape symbol to dynamic patterns
-   Match subdirectories starting with `.` in `{dot: false}` mode ([#​226](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/226))

#### :gear: Infrastructure

-   Move from TSLint to ESLint ([#​233](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/233))

</details>

---

### Renovate configuration

:date: **Schedule**: At any time (no schedule defined).

:vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.

:recycle: **Rebasing**: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or if you modify the PR title to begin with "`rebase!`".

:no_bell: **Ignore**: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again.

---

 - [ ] <!-- renovate-rebase -->If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box

---

Newsflash: Renovate has joined WhiteSource, and is now free for all use. [Learn more](https://renovate.whitesourcesoftware.com/blog/renovate-is-now-part-of-whitesource/) or view updated [terms](https://renovate.whitesourcesoftware.com/terms-of-service/) and [privacy](https://renovate.whitesourcesoftware.com/privacy-policy/) policies.

**Other information:**
Previously, the `build-tauri` job would fail on Ubuntu because `webkit2gtk` was not installed. This PR creates a separate job for Ubuntu which installs `webkit2gtk` before running the steps from `build-tauri`.

title: set timeout on `yarn test` in Github Actions
body:
It has been hanging on MacOS builds. Although we would want to fix this hang long term. This is a temporary way to deal with it and prevent future occurrences of swamping the CI. It would be surprising if jest tests ran longer than 15 minutes.

- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix: #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)

**Other information:**
This PR fixes the following issues when running `cd ./tools/rust/cargo-tauri-bundle && cargo build --target=x86_64-apple-darwin`:

```
error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared type or module `fs`
  --> src/bundle/appimage_bundle.rs:43:5
   |
43 |     fs::remove_dir_all(&package_dir)
   |     ^^ use of undeclared type or module `fs`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0433`.
error: could not compile `cargo-tauri-bundle`.
```
```
error[E0599]: no method named `chain_err` found for type `std::result::Result<(), std::io::Error>` in the current scope
  --> src/bundle/appimage_bundle.rs:45:8
   |
45 |       .chain_err(|| format!("Failed to remove old {}", package_base_name))?;
   |        ^^^^^^^^^ method not found in `std::result::Result<(), std::io::Error>`
   |
   = help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is in scope
   = note: the following traits are implemented but not in scope, perhaps add a `use` for one of them:
           candidate #1: `use crate::ResultExt;`
           candidate #2: `use crate::error_chain::ChainedError;`
           candidate #3: `use crate::error_chain::example_generated::inner::ResultExt;`
           candidate #4: `use crate::error_chain::example_generated::ResultExt;`
           and 2 others

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: could not compile `cargo-tauri-bundle`.
```

title: chore(monorepo): cleanup
body:
This is a massive restructuring of the repo to cleanup the structure and take the last chance to resolve some naming concerns for the launch.

Closes #69.

title: Configure Renovate
body:
Welcome to [Renovate](https://renovatebot.com)! This is an onboarding PR to help you understand and configure settings before regular Pull Requests begin. :vertical_traffic_light: To activate Renovate, merge this Pull Request. To disable Renovate, simply close this Pull Request unmerged. --- ### Detected Package Files * `cli/tauri-cli/Cargo.toml` (cargo) * `cli/tauri.js/templates/src-tauri/Cargo.toml` (cargo) * `tauri/Cargo.toml` (cargo) * `cli/tauri.js/package.json` (npm) ### Configuration :abcd: Renovate has detected a custom config for this PR. Feel free to ask for [help](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/config-help/issues) if you have any doubts and would like it reviewed. Important: Now that this branch is edited, Renovate can't rebase it from the base branch any more. If you make changes to the base branch that could impact this onboarding PR, please merge them manually. You have configured Renovate to use branch `dev` as base branch. ### What to Expect With your current configuration, Renovate will create 33 Pull Requests:
fix(deps): pin dependencies - Schedule: "at any time" - Branch name: `renovate/pin-dependencies` - Merge into: `dev` - Pin [@iarna/toml](https://togithub.com/iarna/iarna-toml) to `2.2.3` - Pin [babel-plugin-system-import-transformer](https://togithub.com/thgreasi/babel-plugin-system-import-transformer) to `4.0.0` - Pin [chalk](https://togithub.com/chalk/chalk) to `2.4.2` - Pin [chokidar](https://togithub.com/paulmillr/chokidar) to `3.0.2` - Pin [cross-spawn](https://togithub.com/moxystudio/node-cross-spawn) to `6.0.5` - Pin [dotenv](https://togithub.com/motdotla/dotenv) to `8.2.0` - Pin [eslint](https://togithub.com/eslint/eslint) to `6.6.0` - Pin [eslint-config-standard](https://togithub.com/standard/eslint-config-standard) to `14.1.0` - Pin [eslint-plugin-import](https://togithub.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import) to `2.18.2` - Pin [fast-glob](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob) to `3.0.4` - Pin [fs-extra](https://togithub.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra) to `8.1.0` - Pin [html-webpack-inline-source-plugin](https://togithub.com/dustinjackson/html-webpack-inline-source-plugin) to `0.0.10` - Pin [imagemin](https://togithub.com/imagemin/imagemin) to `7.0.1` - Pin [imagemin-optipng](https://togithub.com/imagemin/imagemin-optipng) to `7.1.0` - Pin [imagemin-pngquant](https://togithub.com/imagemin/imagemin-pngquant) to `8.0.0` - Pin [imagemin-zopfli](https://togithub.com/imagemin/imagemin-zopfli) to `6.0.0` - Pin [is-png](https://togithub.com/sindresorhus/is-png) to `2.0.0` - Pin [jest-mock-process](https://togithub.com/EpicEric/jest-mock-process) to `1.2.0` - Pin [lint-staged](https://togithub.com/okonet/lint-staged) to `9.4.3` - Pin [lodash.debounce](https://togithub.com/lodash/lodash) to `4.0.8` - Pin [lodash.template](https://togithub.com/lodash/lodash) to `4.5.0` - Pin [minimist](https://togithub.com/substack/minimist) to `1.2.0` - Pin [ms](https://togithub.com/zeit/ms) to `2.1.2` - Pin [png2icons](https://togithub.com/idesis-gmbh/png2icons) to `2.0.1` - Pin [promise](https://togithub.com/then/promise) to `8.0.3` - Pin [read-chunk](https://togithub.com/sindresorhus/read-chunk) to `3.2.0` - Pin [sharp](https://togithub.com/lovell/sharp) to `0.23.2` - Pin [webpack-merge](https://togithub.com/survivejs/webpack-merge) to `4.2.1` - Pin [webpack-shell-plugin](https://togithub.com/1337programming/webpack-shell-plugin) to `0.5.0`

See docs for `prhourlylimit` for details. --- :question: Got questions? Check out Renovate's [Docs](https://docs.renovatebot.com/), particularly the Getting Started section. If you need any further assistance then you can also [request help here](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/config-help/issues). --- Newsflash: Renovate has joined WhiteSource, and is now free for all use. If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

title: feat/web-view
body:
This PR introduces testing, linting and we now are consuming upstream web-view. Using Boscop's crate is a temporary thing until we get it working. Then we will probably publish our own crate and track his in order to keep things safe.

Requesting immediate merge so that everyone can profit from testing.

title: Github Actions CI Process - Build Rust
body:
**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)
- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] New Binding Issue #___
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [x] Other, please describe: CI process

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)
- [ ] Yes. Issue #___
- [x] No


**The PR fulfills these requirements:**
- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch and _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix: #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [x] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**
This is following up on the discussion in #48. This PR currently builds anything with a cargo.toml as a minimal / first step check. Future steps may include building and testing against the smoke tests. Many of the builds currently fail though so not sure how we want to proceed with that. It may very well be my misunderstanding, but opening this to begin the discussion.

Here is an example of what a run will look like as it doesn't seem to have run on this PR.
https://github.com/jbolda/tauri/runs/276926274

title: feat(cli)  [WIP]
body:
This is a tracking PR for getting the CLI up to speed.

### `tauri init`
- [x] init creates tauri.conf.js
- [x] init creates src-tauri folder
- [x] force overwriting
- [x] logging
- [x] JSDoc
- [x] internal sanity checking

### `tauri dev`
- [x] parse tauri.conf.js
- [x] compile rust crates
- [x] start rust main()
- [x] create UI window
- [ ] use pax to transpile the JS and use our own tiny_http server
- [ ] create a webpack server if none specified
- [ ] editing the source reloads 
- [ ] webpack + babel sources

### `tauri build`
- [x] parse tauri.conf.js
- [x] start bundler
- [x] mac
- [ ] win (looks like rough sailing at the moment)
- [ ] linux
- [ ] debug

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:

title: fix(tauri) embedded-server edge case with config host
body:
**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)
<!--
If you are introducing a new binding, you must reference an issue where this binding has been proposed, discussed and approved by the maintainers.
-->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] New Binding Issue #___
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)
<!--
If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications in an attached issue. Filing a PR with breaking changes that has not been discussed and approved by the maintainers in an issue will be immediately closed.
-->

- [ ] Yes. Issue #___
- [ ] No


**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [ ] It's submitted to the `dev` branch and _not_ the `master` branch
- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix: #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [ ] Any necessary documentation has been added or updated [in the docs](https://github.com/quasarframework/tauri/tree/dev/docs) (for faster update click on "Suggest an edit on GitHub" at bottom of page) or explained in the PR's description.

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

There's an edge case for how the webview and our embeddedServer loads its URLs.
When the config -> host is set to something like `localhost` or `127.0.0.1` (without http:// protocol), the server starts correctly, but the webview doesn't. We have to explicitely set the http protocol on the webview, but not on the embedded web server.

So, with this PR, we add the protocol for the webview load URL if its not there, and we always remove it from the config host. With this approach, the embedded web server MUST be served locally.

There are some other changes because I ran cargofmt.
